data.message: Coaches say he's been as impressive as anyone early on at training camp

Its a story of team. And #NeverEverQuit.  Josh Hamilton lifted up the Texas Rangers yesterday. Kind of thinking the #LoneStarState is doing the same thing for him. This is the good stuff, folks. #GoRangers

It looks like we have our latest preseason Super Bowl guarantee.

This one comes to us from New York Giants running back #AndreWilliams, who told The New York Post on Monday that the Giants should expect to be playing in San Francisco this February.

"It's a new year, we're setting new goals, we're trying to make it to the Super Bowl," Williams said. "Not trying, we're going to the Super Bowl."

The next two months are going to be GREAT in the MLB pennant races! That's wild when you have all of the largest US cities involved: Yankees, Mets, Cubs, Dodgers and Angels. Then add the Royals, Twins, Astros, Blue Jays and Orioles in the A.L. AND the Nationals, Cardinals, Pirates, and Giants either in first place, in a wild card spot or closely sniffing the playoffs. What would you say if someone told you the Cubs, Mets and Astros would be doing so well on August 3rd!!! It should be fun.
Go "O's "
Last year wasn't the easiest for New York Giants wide receiver Rueben Randle but he closed the year strong.
He always has a few good games at the end of the season. He has yet to progress & has cost Eli multiple INTs over the years because be doesn't know his routes or stops running them.
Hopefully with Beckham and Cruz on the field Randle with get a lot of wide open looks

We would like to congratulate HSS's Dr. Scott Rodeo, Orthopedic Surgeon, on being named Head Team Physician of the New York Giants! Dr. Rodeo has been an associate team physician since 2000. Despite this being a rebuilding year for the Braves and the NL East being the weakest division in baseball, third place isn't so bad. I'm really excited for next year. I can't wait to see the young players develop into the team we'll carry over to the new ballpark. A new era of Braves baseball.

Folks... Honestly, I don't know how many more times we can say this or how else we can stress this...

Jason Pierre-Paul is NOT under contract with the New York Giants. They can not cut him, release him, waive him or anything of the sort.

He's been tendered their franchise player and he won't sign until he can pass the team's physical. And the Giants likely wouldn't let him sign until he could, either.

And the reason he won't sign now is so he avoids the NFI list.

There's nothing the team can do right now. Nothing. Unless they wanted to withdraw their tender offer, making him an unrestricted free agent. Which they're not going to do.

As everyone points out, if they withdraw the tender, he WILL NEVER sign back with the Giants, and they will lose him for nothing.   The best case scenario is that he plays after week 6 or so, and comes back and plays well
Preach on. I'm tired of reading the same comment over and over. Can't we just be positive that he is in contact more than he was? Go Giants
Question the Giants have the rights to him so other teams can't negotiate a contract with him and he can't sign with another team right?

To be honest he's just a extra peace at this point if he heals up and can play ok put him in the rotation but Moore and Aryes and Wynn we got some de's on the roster not worried about him last time he made a impact was 2011 the Giants  already allocated the franchise tender to the cap and put it aside so if they give him it all or not it don't matter  u wanna see what he's got before u cut bait but I think it's his last year here if he can even contribute

Actually withdrawing their tender is something they CAN and SHOULD do. Yes I understand that means they will likely get nothing in return for him but at the point I'm not sure that's a bad thing. What do you think his value is on the market? I have an answer, NOT MUCH. He has demonstrated terrible judegement which resulted in hime losing his finger and then mad it worse by shunning the people who reached out to help him. Yes they had a vested interest in helping him but he made a "BUSINESS DECISION" to not see them and their doctors so I think the Giants would be best suited to make a similar decision to deal with JPP and an UFA or not at all.

Withdrawaling his tender is the best solution. He likely will not play much this year, when he does play I can't see a huge impact unless a miracle happens.... His market and value is shot to hell.....so why keep him around? I guess waiting on that miracle.

JPP has a LONG way to go before he will return to be a productive NFL player. He's lost a lot of muscle and conditioning which will take time and work to rebuild in addition to his hand healing and regaining strength...
He'll be fine , just lock him up after he pass's a physical super talented even missing a finger. he's the best we have .
Some of our fans are stupid, just as simple as that.
If they remove the tender he can sign anywhere id he plays this year and walks next year i believe the Giants get a 3rd round pick
It's simple we're stuck with him for this season. He'll sign it once he's able to play which nobody really knows exactly if and when he'll be ready.
Yet people will still question this. You just can't fix stupid.
If he's unable to perform, are the Giants stuck paying him and losing cap money for this year ?
CUT HIM!!  DERPPPPP!!!!!
It's not that hard of a concept to grasp

Who are the starting Safeties for The New York Giants? We don't know yet and the players don't know yet either. However the man that gets to make that call Dave Merritt tells us what he thinks about the development at the position.

Just when you thought the LBs were the weakest position on the Giants defense here come the safeties, the Giants had a chance to go out and sign a veteran safety after Rolle left but instead they decided to overpay some mediocre LBs , Marshall Newhouse and Dwayne Harris and go with the crap they currently have and now it looks like they are having second thoughts abou it, when your only starting safety is a second round rookie who struggles in pass coverage you know how bad things are at the position. Once again this one is on our IDIOT GM and his staff, opposing OCs and veteran QBs will have a field day going after our safeties, last year the Giants ranked dead last against the run and next year it wouldnt surprise me if they are dead last in pass defense and tops in the league allowing passes of 20 yards or more.
